result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. NATHANIEL I R BORST

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on December 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant NATHANIEL I R BORST in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for NATHANIEL I R BORST.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Kapelis states their is no agreement and requests a Jury Trial in 2022CF76. Statement by ADA McElroy, informs the Court that the defendant has another case scheduled for Initial Appearance next week. 2022CF76 - Court sets for Status Hearing on December 19, 2022 at 2:30 PM and all motions and witness lists to be filed the day before. Statement by ADA McElroy - revokes the offers in both cases. 2022CF71 - Court sets for Status Hearing on the same date and time.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Status Report

ADDRESS INFO for NATHANIEL I R BORST
Current: 533 4th Street Room #6, Algoma, WI 54201 United States  (Effective: 09-09-2022)
Prior: 323 S Washington St, Berlin, WI 54923
Return date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status hearing on May 31, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

CASE NOT CALLED

Defendant NATHANIEL I R BORST in court.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for NATHANIEL I R BORST.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. The Initial appearance was held on defendant's new case 2022CF76.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on May 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:09 PM Defendant NATHANIEL I R BORST appeared by video.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for NATHANIEL I R BORST.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court notes bond has been set. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the right to a prelim. Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court. Attorney Kapelis acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Kapelis enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant on both counts.

Court notes defendant has another case, 21CF76. Defendant states he is applying for the public defender and is waiting to see who will represent him for this case.. Court sets 21CF76 for an adjourned initial on May 10 at 10:00 AM and 21CF71 for a status hearing. Mandatory Appearance.

Court adjourned at 1:14 PM.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely
Letter to the Court from Atty Kapelis dated April 25, 2022 re: zoom request

Defendant called and stated he was sick and wanted an adjournment. Informed that defendant that he has an attorney and needs to contact his attorney. Also informed the defendant that he needs to apply to the PD's office on the new case 22CF76.
Atty Michael Kapelis
Initial appearance on April 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

Call from the person that lives at the address that is listed as the defendant's address and informed us that the address listed is not the defendant's address and wants the address removed. Informed her that we just can't remove the address and that the address listed was verbally given in court. Informed her to make contact with the defendant and tell him he needs to change his address with the court.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

1:01 PM Defendant NATHANIEL I R BORST by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Kapelis appeared by video for the defendant. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom.  Court questions defendant on his address and phone number. Court has reviewed a probable cause statement and finds probable cause that a crime may have been committed.  ADA makes bond recommendation. Atty Kapelis makes bond recommendation. Court orders bond at $300 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Court sets Initial Appearance for April 25, 2022 at 1:00 PM.

Court adjourned 1:04 PM.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
